content.webTitle: Robins derailed by draw on route to promotion

fields.headline: Robins derailed by draw on route to promotion
fields.bodyText: Cheltenham Town last night missed the chance to clinch promotion from the Third Division when they were held to a goalless draw at Carlisle. Third-placed Cheltenham must go to the newly crowned champions Plymouth while Mansfield, two points behind, entertain Carlisle in their final games on Saturday. But, given the Robins' vastly superior goal difference, a point at Home Park will see them up. The Conference's top two both lost last night, the leaders Boston falling 2-0 at Scarborough while Dagenham & Redbridge went down 1-0 at Hereford. · You've read the piece, now have your say. Email your comments, as sharp or as stupid as you like, to the football.editor@guardianunlimited.co.uk.
